name.ingredients: 500g firm white fish (such as cod, haddock, or tilapia), cut into chunks, 1/2 cup plain yogurt,2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder, 1/2 teaspoon paprika (for color), Fresh coriander leaves, Lemon wedges, Sliced onions, Salt to taste.
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, ground coriander, garam masala, cumin powder, paprika, and salt.
Add the fish pieces and coat them well with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat your grill or oven to 200°C (400°F). If using a grill, ensure it is preheated and well-oiled.
If using a grill, thread the marinated fish pieces onto skewers. Grill the fish for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until it is cooked through and has a nice charred surface.
If using an oven, place the fish pieces on a baking tray lined with foil or parchment paper. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and slightly charred.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves, lemon wedges, and sliced onions. Serve hot with naan, roti, or as an appetizer with mint chutney.
